company_description: Acuren is the leading provider of non-destructive testing and related rope access industrial services to energy and industrial end markets in North America. Acuren serves over 8,650 individual customer sites through its 5,300+ employees across more than 90 field offices in the United States, Canada, and the United Kingdom. The company is headquartered in Houston, TX and Edmonton, AB.

Advanced Drainage Systems, Inc. (ADS) was the world's largest producer of corrugated high density polyethylene (HDPE) pipe used for agriculture, construction and retention, and drainage. The company had a global network of 53 domestic and international manufacturing plants and more than 24 distribution centers.

Air Methods was the largest domestic air medical transport provider, serving 48 states with over 275 bases of operations. The company also operated a leading air tourism business. Air Methods’ fleet of owned, leased or maintained aircrafts featured approximately 500 helicopters and fixed wing aircrafts. The company employed more than 4,500 team members.

Amentum is a leading contractor to the U.S. federal government and select allied national governments, supporting programs of critical national significance across defense, security and intelligence, energy, and environmental cleanup. Amentum previously operated as the Management Services segment within AECOM (NYSE: ACM) and is headquartered in Chantilly, Virginia. The company employs more than 37,000 professionals, approximately 17,000 of whom have security clearance and more than 8,000 of whom are U.S. military veterans.
A premier, global leader in design, engineering, validation, and manufacturing of driveline, metal forming, powertrain, and casting technologies for automotive, commercial, and industrial markets.
Anthony was the world’s largest manufacturer of specialty glass, commercial glass refrigerator and freezer doors, case lighting, and display and merchandising systems.

Aramsco is a leading specialty distributor to contractors and facility maintenance professionals throughout the U.S. and Canada. The company sells over 45,000 critical consumable and equipment products across its footprint of more than 80 branches, with a focus on restoration, abatement, facility maintenance, traffic safety, professional cleaning, surface preparation, and stone care end markets. Aramsco is headquartered in Paulsboro, NJ and has more than 1,000 employees.
Arizona Chemical was the world's leading producer and refiner of pine chemicals, with environmentally friendly products used in various everyday items.

BELFOR is the global leader in damage recovery and restoration with operations in 34 countries. The company serves customers in significant times of need, ranging from individual homeowners who may have a small loss to multinational manufacturing businesses with millions of dollars of damage. BELFOR employs more than 10,000 team members.
Blue Bird was the leading independent designer and manufacturer of school buses, with more than 592,000 buses sold since its formation in 1927 and approximately 180,000 buses in operation.
Cambridge was the world’s leading designer and manufacturer of metal conveyor belts for use in various industries.
During the partnership with American Securities, Caribbean Restaurants held the exclusive franchise from Burger King Corporation to own and operate Burger King restaurants in Puerto Rico.

At acquisition, Chromaflo was a leading independent global supplier of colorant systems, chemical and pigment dispersions, serving customers in architectural and industrial coatings, as well as the thermoset composites market.
exit_status: Merged with Ferro Corporation to form Vibrantz Technologies in April 2022

company_description: During the partnership with American Securities, CPBC operated 11 radio stations in three mid-sized markets: Modesto/Stockton, California, Anchorage, Alaska and Des Moines, Iowa. The company had the #1 or #2 market share in each of these markets.

Conair is a leading designer, manufacturer, and marketer of branded personal care and small kitchen appliances, cookware, hairbrushes & accessories, cosmetic bags, and travel accessories. Conair's brands include Cuisinart®, Conair®, Babyliss®, Scunci®, and Waring®.
Leading provider of minerals and material solutions for the industrial and energy markets

CPM is a leading supplier of innovative, highly-engineered processing and automation equipment serving the global food, industrial and renewable energy industries. CPM’s globally recognized brands, 34 facilities across 4 continents, and sales presence across 100 countries allow the company to serve its 5,000+ customers worldwide.

CS Energy is a leading renewable energy services business focused on the engineering, procurement, and construction (EPC) and development of solar and storage projects in the Northeastern United States.
CTB was a leading manufacturer of feeding, watering, ventilation and heating equipment for the poultry and swine industries; commercial egg-laying systems; and feed and grain storage bins.
Delphi Midstream Partners acquired, built and operated companies and assets in the midstream energy sector.
Leading U.S. direct mail retailer of home healthcare, comfort, and convenience products for the 'over 55' market
El Pollo Loco was the nation’s leading quick-service restaurant chain specializing in marinated, flame-broiled chicken with more than 320 locations.

Emerald was a leading producer and marketer of specialty chemicals for niche consumer and industrial end-markets, including flavors & fragrances, food & beverage, personal and household care, composites, structural adhesives, coatings, and flooring.

At acquisition, Fairmount Santrol was one of the largest producers of industrial sand in the United States. Fairmount Santrol serviced a wide variety of markets and industries, including oil and gas, glass, foundry, abrasive, filtration, pool filter, golf courses, artificial sports fields, and play sand.
exit_status: IPO in October 2014, Merged with Unimim Corporation to create Covia in June 2018

company_description: FiberMark was a global marketer and world-class manufacturer of premium and innovative covering materials for various applications including office products, publishing, luxury packaging, technical/industrial, and graphic design.

FleetPride is a leading national distributor of aftermarket parts and a full-service provider for the U.S. heavy-duty truck industry. The company carries a wide array of parts, including brakes, drums, engine systems, electrical, axel, wheel end, and drivetrain, and offers over 1 million SKUs across 490 brands and 320 product categories, including its own private label offering. It also offers service and repair for heavy-duty trucks and trailers across the United States. FleetPride operates under four segments: Branch, National Accounts, Wholesale, and Service.

Foundation Building Materials, Inc. is a specialty building products distributor of wallboard, suspended ceiling systems, metal framing, and complementary and other products throughout North America. Based in Santa Ana, California, the company employs more than 6,000 employees and operates more than 300 branches across the United States and Canada.

Frontier was one of the largest U.S. based producers of cotton and cotton/polyester blend yarns for the knitting and weaving industries and holds market leading positions in open-end spinning. Yarn produced by Frontier was used in sportswear, undergarments, socks, sweaters, fleece, denim, and home furnishings.

FullBloom is a leading child development services platform, providing academic, behavioral, and emotional intervention to young children and students. FullBloom’s 12,000 educators and healthcare professionals work in schools and behavioral health centers across the country to help vulnerable children reach their full potential through evidence-based programs including special education, Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA), math and literacy intervention, counseling, and professional development.

General Chemical was a leading North American manufacturer of a broad line of organic and inorganic chemicals for various industries and applications including water treatment, food/beverage, pharmaceutical, pulp and paper, industrial processing, and agriculture.

At acquisition, Grede was a leading manufacturer of cast, machined and assembled components for transportation and industrial markets. In August 2014, Grede merged with HHI and Metaldyne to create Metaldyne Performance Group. MPG subsequently went public in December 2014 and was sold to American Axle & Manufacturing in April 2017.
exit_status: Merged with HHI and Metaldyne to create Metaldyne Performance Group in August 2014, which was sold in April 2017

company_description: GT Technologies was an international leader in the engineering and manufacturing of performance-critical valvetrain components and systems for gasoline and diesel internal combustion engines.
Healthy Directions was a leading direct marketer of branded nutritional supplements and other health merchandise.

Henry Company was a leading North American manufacturer and supplier of roofing and building envelope products and systems that were critical for managing the flow of water, vapor, and air through the entire building envelope. Henry’s extensive geographic footprint of 12 strategically located manufacturing facilities effectively served the repair, remodel, and new housing market in addition to the broader commercial market throughout the U.S. and Canada.

Hexion is a leading, global producer of adhesives and performance materials that enable the production of engineered wood products and other specialty materials used in high performance coatings for industrial applications. Key end markets include residential and non-residential construction, repair / remodel, furniture, energy, agriculture and automotive. Hexion serves more than 1,200 companies across approximately 60 countries through a manufacturing network of 27 production facilities. The company is headquartered in Columbus, Ohio.
At acquisition, HHI was the largest North American manufacturer of highly engineered, safety-critical, forged components for automotive consumers, principally in the light vehicle market.
exit_status: Merged with Metaldyne and Grede to create Metaldyne Performance Group in August 2014, which was sold in April 2017

company_description: Ketema was a public mini-conglomerate with 10 autonomous operating divisions operating in the aerospace and process control equipment areas.
Chicago-based firm committed to providing capital to create profitable growth by acquiring, financing, owning and operating energy companies and assets in North America

Learning Care Group is the second largest provider of early childhood education and care in the U.S., serving children six weeks to 12 years across 39 states and Washington, D.C. The company’s community of schools operate under 11 brands including La Petite Academy, Childtime, Tutor Time, Everbrook Academy, The Children’s Courtyard, and Montessori Unlimited.
Liberty Tire Recycling was the premier provider of tire recycling services in North America, reclaiming about 1.5 billion pounds of rubber for innovative, eco-friendly products.
MECS was the global leader in providing proprietary process technology, specialty products, and technical services to the global sulfuric acid industry serving various markets.

Meridian is a leading manufacturer of high-value adhesive technologies. With a broad portfolio of specialty formulated products and a solutions-based approach, Meridian serves customers across the electronics, infrastructure, flooring, packaging, and product assembly markets. The company has 25 facilities and serves over 5,000 customers in North America, Asia, and Europe. Meridian is headquartered in Charlotte, NC.
At acquisition, Metaldyne was a manufacturer of engineered metal-based components for light vehicle engine, transmission, and driveline applications.
exit_status: Sold to American Axle & Manufacturing in April 2017

company_description: MPG was a leading provider of highly-engineered components for use in powertrain and safety-critical platforms for the global light, commercial, and industrial vehicle markets.
exit_status: Sale in April 2017 to American Axle & Manufacturing

company_description: Milk Specialties Global is a leading human and animal nutrition company. The Human Nutrition Business Unit specializes in whey and milk protein ingredients for sports nutrition and functional foods. The Animal Nutrition division offers innovative products for the dairy industry.
Miltex was the leading supplier of hand-held surgical and dental instruments sold through distributors to surgical centers and medical offices.

During the partnership with American Securities, Mortgage Contracting Services (MCS) provided critical specialized services for mortgage servicers and originators across the mortgage lifecycle. The company provided field services such as inspections and property preservation for mortgages in default and real estate owned properties.
MVE was the largest worldwide manufacturer and distributor of systems used to transport and store cryogenic elements.

MW Industries is a leading provider of precision metal components, including springs, fasteners, bellows, and other precision-machined parts. The company serves original equipment manufacturers, distributors, and aftermarket customers across a diverse set of end markets, including medical, industrial, aerospace, electronics, energy, agriculture, and construction. MW’s global footprint of 25 manufacturing facilities and custom build-to-order capabilities paired with engineering design support enables its global customer base to efficiently achieve design objectives.
NEP Broadcasting is the leading international provider of outsourced teleproduction services critical to the delivery of live sports and entertainment events.

NAPA is the leading single-specialty anesthesia and perioperative management company in the United States. Founded in 1986 with a mission to seek excellence in patient care and create value for clinicians and partners. Employs over 5,000 clinicians and staff delivering services at 400+ facilities in 22 states and DC to over two million patients annually.

NWN Carousel is a leading provider of cloud communications and technology hardware, software, and services for commercial, enterprise, and public sector organizations. The company serves over 3,000 customers throughout the United States across numerous application areas, including networking, unified communications, security, contact center, managed devices, and visual collaboration and workspaces. NWN Carousel’s offerings are underpinned by the company’s Experience Management Platform, which is a proprietary software product that delivers comprehensive analytics, IT asset management, and cost optimization to customers while enabling them to have a cohesive, integrated, real-time view of their entire communications technology stack. Headquartered in Boston, MA, the company has more than 1,000 employees and 14 locations across the United States.

OnTrac is a leading last-mile delivery solutions provider, serving eCommerce retailers. The company provides same-day and next-day residential delivery services for small parcels (<50 lbs) through its fast growing network of 110+ facilities across 31 states.
Oreck was the leading manufacturer and direct-to-consumer marketer of premium vacuum cleaners and other household products.

Oregon Tool was a global manufacturer and marketer of replacement parts, equipment, and accessories for various markets including forestry, lawn, garden, farm, ranch, agriculture, and concrete cutting and finishing. The company sold its products in more than 110 countries worldwide.
PDM Bridge was a leader in the bridge fabrication industry with extensive experience in complex bridge structures.
status_current: Sale on behalf of lenders in November 2013

company_description: Potbelly Sandwich Works is a unique, experiential, sandwich-focused fast casual restaurant concept with locations in more than 16 states and international locations in the Middle East.

Presidio is the leading provider of professional and managed services for advanced IT solutions. Presidio addresses its clients’ complete information technology lifecycle – enabling clients to plan, design, implement, test and operate their technology investments.
Press Ganey was the largest provider of patient satisfaction and performance measurement solutions to the healthcare industry.
Primary Energy Ventures was a leading developer, owner and operator of power and thermal cogeneration systems onsite at industrial facilities.

At the time of acquisition, Prince was a leading global manufacturer of mineral-based specialty additives and products. The company leveraged its deep knowledge of minerals to provide unique products and solutions to its more than 2,000 customers across more than 35 end markets. Prince had deep expertise in Manganese, Chromium, Iron, Lithium, Cobalt, and Zircon processing. Key end markets included electronics, construction, agriculture, consumer products, oil & gas, brick & tile, and automotive. The company employed approximately 1,400 employees across 25 facilities on six continents, with its headquarters in Houston, TX.
exit_status: Acquired Ferro Corporation and merged with Chromaflo Technologies to create Vibrantz Technologies in April 2022

company_description: r-pac is a leading global provider of branded packaging, trim, and supply chain services and solutions from concept to execution to customers across the retail supply chain. r-pac serves a broad range of end markets, including apparel, footwear, accessories, electronics, home bed and bath, home décor, beauty, patio, and garden, among other product categories. r-pac’s advanced proprietary software with business intelligence and analytics engines offers connected merchandise, supply chain and compliance and brand protection solutions, often complemented with its core product offering.

RealManage, which includes GrandManors and CiraConnect, is one of the leading tech-enabled homeowner association and condominium management companies in the United States. RealManage offers innovative management services to community associations of all types and sizes, including homeowner associations, condominium associations, cooperatives, municipal utility districts, and large master-planned communities.

Robertson Fuel Systems was the world leader in fuel containment and ballistic tolerance, designing, manufacturing, and fielding crashworthy, self-sealing fuel systems for aircraft and ground combat vehicles.

Royal Adhesives and Sealants was a leading producer of proprietary, high-performance adhesives and sealants. They offered a broad range of specialty formulated products designed to solve complex bonding, laminating, and sealing applications across various markets including aerospace and defense, construction, specialty packaging, automotive, and industrial.

SeaStar Solutions was the leading global provider of OEM and aftermarket products and accessories for the recreational marine and related markets. Sold around the world under the SeaStar, Sierra, BayStar, Prime Line, and Proheat brands, the company’s products were recognized for their quality, reliability and technical innovation.

SimonMed is one of the largest independent outpatient medical imaging providers and physician radiology practices in the United States. SimonMed has over 150 sites across 10 states and more than 200 subspecialty-trained radiologists. SimonMed offers the full modality of diagnostic scans, including 3T MRI, CT, ultrasound, 3-D mammography, PET/CT, nuclear medicine, DEXA, X-rays, among others.

SOLV Energy (formerly known as Swinerton Renewable Energy) is a leading renewable energy services business focused on the engineering, procurement, and construction of utility-scale solar and storage projects across the United States. As of 2022, the company has successfully constructed over 11 gigawatts of solar capacity in 29 states and provides operations and maintenance services to over seven gigawatts of solar assets in North America. SOLV Energy, which was established in 2008, was formerly two business units of Swinerton Incorporated, a large and diversified construction company.

Specialty Care was a leading provider of outsourced operating room services including perfusion and intraoperative neuromonitoring, autotransfusion, sterile processing management, surgical assist, and minimally invasive surgical support.

Tekni-Plex was one of the world’s leading manufacturers of innovative, high quality packaging and tubing materials for products used every day by millions of consumers around the globe. The company operated 25 manufacturing sites in nine countries across North America, Europe, Latin America, and Asia.
region: North America, Europe, Latin America, Asia

company_description: The Aspen Group is the nation’s leading multi-vertical retail healthcare support organization, offering essential business support services to consumer healthcare brands under various trade names.
TNP Enterprises was an electric utility company engaged in the generation, transmission and distribution of electricity serving parts of Texas and New Mexico.

Trace3 is a leading provider of technology hardware, software, and services to over 3,500 enterprise and mid-market customers in the United States, with core expertise in hybrid cloud, security & networking, and data intelligence applications.

Ulterra designs and manufactures matrix and steel PDC bits used in drilling of oil-and-gas wells, as well as downhole tools. The Company's products are manufactured with customer- and region-specific modifications that increase drilling efficiency and reduce total drilling costs. Ulterra has a broad North American presence spanning the key U.S. and Canadian oil and gas regions. The Company also has a global footprint with operations in countries throughout the Middle-East, Africa, Latin America, and Asia-Pacific.
region: North America, Middle-East, Africa, Latin America, Asia-Pacific

company_description: Unifrax is a leading global manufacturer of specialty materials and highly engineered products that provide high temperature insulating solutions.
Unifrax was the premier global provider of high-temperature insulation products providing innovative heat management solutions and energy savings for a broad range of industries.

Unison Site Management is the leading independent cell site company in the nation. Unison is a specialized investment management company that purchases wireless antennae leases and cell ground tower leases from cell site owners.

United Distribution Group was a leading provider of industrial supplies and services, from underground mining products to gasket and sealing products, to end users in the energy and natural resources markets.

UFP is the largest developer and operator of fitness clubs under the Planet Fitness brand. It is headquartered in Austin, Texas, and serves approximately 1.2 million members across more than 190 clubs in 14 states.

ViaPath Technologies leads the industry with critical communication technologies and software solutions for government agencies, at-risk communities, correctional facilities, corrections officers, incarcerated individuals and their friends and family.

Vibrantz Technologies is a leading global manufacturer of mineral-based specialty additives, pigments, colorants, and functional ingredients for specialty coatings, glass, and porcelain enamels. The company serves diverse end markets including electronics, building & construction, industrial, automotive, and appliances and sanitaryware.
VUTEk was the world’s leading designer and manufacturer of superwide digital inkjet printers for use in billboard and other out-of-home advertising displays.
One of the world’s leading manufacturers and distributors of mechanical power transmission products for Agricultural and Lawn & turf machinery

During the partnership with American Securities, Westward published more than 60 community newspapers and related websites, targeted publications and digital products serving the Houston, East Texas, and Colorado Springs markets.
status_current: Sale on behalf of lenders in June 2012
